pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12991660131/job/36229697429)
Thanks for the contribution!
Thanks for the contribution!
You can reuse `Coloring.sum` from above, if you use `recolorOfEmbedding`.

Please use `lowerCamelCase` for definitions. E.g.,
```suggestion
def Coloring.sumLeft (c : (G ⊕g H).Coloring γ) : G.Coloring γ := Coloring.mk (c ∘ Sum.inl) <| by
```
There is no `Fin` here. `Colorable.sum_max`?
I failed to find any lemmas that use `SimpleGraph.ChromaticNumber` namespace. IMHO, we should just have `chromaticNumber_sum`.

```suggestion
theorem chromaticNumber_left_le_sum : G.chromaticNumber ≤ (G ⊕g H).chromaticNumber := by
```

```suggestion
theorem chromaticNumber_right_le_sum : H.chromaticNumber ≤ (G ⊕g H).chromaticNumber := by
```

```suggestion
theorem chromaticNumber_sum_eq :
```

```suggestion
lemma coe_castMaxEmbLeft {n m : ℕ} : (castMaxEmbLeft : Fin n → Fin (max n m)) = castMaxLeft m := rfl
```

```suggestion
lemma coe_castMaxEmbRight {n m : ℕ} : (castMaxEmbRight : Fin m → Fin (max n m)) = castMaxRight n := rfl
```

I am going to suggest a few additions. In my opinion, it is okay if you decide to leave these for a future PR.
- Prove that `(cG.sum cH).sumLeft = cG` and `(cG.sum cH).sumRight = cH`
- Prove that `c = c.sumLeft.sum c.sumRight`
- Define a bijection between `(G ⊕g H).Coloring γ` and `(G.Coloring γ) × (H.Coloring γ)`
If you're not going to add these to the PR then maybe add them as TODOs in the module docstring? Other than that, this PR looks pretty much ready.
Sorry, I forgot mark this conversation as resolved, I have added this as `Coloring.sum_sumLeft_eq`, `Coloring.sum_sumRight_eq`, `Coloring.sumLeft_sum_sumRight_eq` and `Coloring.sumEquiv`
This `unfold` isn't needed (and others below).

```suggestion
  rintro (u | u) (v | v) <;> simp
```
`rintro` can be used to make lots of proofs in this file far less verbose. For example

```
def Iso.sumAssoc {I : SimpleGraph γ} : (G ⊕g H) ⊕g I ≃g G ⊕g (H ⊕g I) where
  __ := Equiv.sumAssoc α β γ
  map_rel_iff' := by rintro ((u | u) | u) ((v | v) | v) <;> simp
```

```suggestion
  left_inv c := by simp [sumLeft_sum_sumRight_eq c]
  right_inv p := rfl
```
Again you should be using `rintro` not `intro, cases, rename_i`.
Can this refine be exact? Can you remove the `by; exact`?
Same thing three lines below.

```suggestion
def Coloring.sum (cG : G.Coloring γ) (cH : H.Coloring γ) : (G ⊕g H).Coloring γ where
  toFun := Sum.elim cG cH
  map_rel' {u v} huv := by cases u <;> cases v <;> simp_all [cG.valid, cH.valid]
```

Can you write this using `Hom.comp`? Something like
```suggestion
/-- Get coloring of `G` from coloring of `G ⊕g H` -/
def Coloring.sumLeft (c : (G ⊕g H).Coloring γ) : G.Coloring γ := c.comp ????
```
Same below

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem Coloring.sum_sumLeft (cG : G.Coloring γ) (cH : H.Coloring γ) : (cG.sum cH).sumLeft = cG := rfl

@[simp]
theorem Coloring.sum_sumRight (cG : G.Coloring γ) (cH : H.Coloring γ)  (cG.sum cH).sumRight = cH := rfl
```

```suggestion
theorem chromaticNumber_sum :
    (G ⊕g H).chromaticNumber = max G.chromaticNumber H.chromaticNumber := by
```

```suggestion
theorem Colorable.of_sum_left {n : ℕ} (h : (G ⊕g H).Colorable n) : G.Colorable n :=
  Nonempty.intro (h.some.sumLeft)

theorem Colorable.of_sum_right {n : ℕ} (h : (G ⊕g H).Colorable n) : H.Colorable n :=
  Nonempty.intro (h.some.sumRight)
```

Can we also get
```
@[simp] lemma colorable_sum {n : ℕ} : (G ⊕g H).Colorable n) ↔ G.Colorable n ∧ H.Colorable n :=
```
Can't you use `Fin.castLE` instead of defining those new functions?
Same here. I don't think we want those new definitions

```suggestion
def Coloring.sumLeft (c : (G ⊕g H).Coloring γ) : G.Coloring γ := c.comp Embedding.sumInl.toHom
```
same below

Don't get tricked by dot notation. `sumLeft` comes first
```suggestion
theorem Coloring.sumLeft_sum (cG : G.Coloring γ) (cH : H.Coloring γ) :
    (cG.sum cH).sumLeft = cG := rfl
```
Same below

```suggestion
theorem Coloring.sum_sumLeft_sumRight (c : (G ⊕g H).Coloring γ) :
    c.sumLeft.sum c.sumRight = c := by
```

```suggestion
  ext (u | u) <;> rfl
```

```suggestion
def Coloring.sumEquiv : (G ⊕g H).Coloring γ ≃ G.Coloring γ × H.Coloring γ where
```

```suggestion
theorem chromaticNumber_le_sum_left : G.chromaticNumber ≤ (G ⊕g H).chromaticNumber :=
```
same below

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem chromaticNumber_sum :
```
